1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:

2.verse: to know wisdom and instruction;

3.verse: to receive instruction in wise dealing,

4.verse: to give prudence to the simple,

5.verse: that the wise man may hear, and increase in learning;

6.verse: to understand a proverb and parables,

7.verse: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge;

8.verse: My son, listen to your father’s instruction,

9.verse: for they will be a garland to grace your head,

10.verse: My son, if sinners entice you,

11.verse: If they say, “Come with us.

12.verse: Let’s swallow them up alive like Sheol,

13.verse: We’ll find all valuable wealth.

14.verse: You shall cast your lot among us.

15.verse: My son, don’t walk on the path with them.

16.verse: for their feet run to evil.

17.verse: For the net is spread in vain in the sight of any bird;

18.verse: but these lay in wait for their own blood.

19.verse: So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain.

20.verse: Wisdom calls aloud in the street.

21.verse: She calls at the head of noisy places.

22.verse: “How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity?

23.verse: Turn at my reproof.

24.verse: Because I have called, and you have refused;

25.verse: but you have ignored all my counsel,

26.verse: I also will laugh at your disaster.

27.verse: when calamity overtakes you like a storm,

28.verse: Then they will call on me, but I will not answer.

30.verse: They wanted none of my counsel.

31.verse: Therefore they will eat of the fruit of their own way,

32.verse: For the backsliding of the simple will kill them.

33.verse: But whoever listens to me will dwell securely,

1.verse: My son, if you will receive my words,

2.verse: so as to turn your ear to wisdom,

3.verse: yes, if you call out for discernment,

4.verse: if you seek her as silver,

5.verse: then you will understand the fear of Yahweh,

6.verse: For Yahweh gives wisdom.

7.verse: He lays up sound wisdom for the upright.

8.verse: that he may guard the paths of justice,

9.verse: Then you will understand righteousness and justice,

10.verse: For wisdom will enter into your heart.

11.verse: Discretion will watch over you.

12.verse: to deliver you from the way of evil,

13.verse: who forsake the paths of uprightness,

14.verse: who rejoice to do evil,

15.verse: who are crooked in their ways,

16.verse: to deliver you from the strange woman,

17.verse: who forsakes the friend of her youth,

18.verse: for her house leads down to death,

19.verse: None who go to her return again,

20.verse: So you may walk in the way of good men,

21.verse: For the upright will dwell in the land.

22.verse: But the wicked will be cut off from the land.

1.verse: My son, don’t forget my teaching;

2.verse: for they will add to you length of days,

3.verse: Don’t let kindness and truth forsake you.

4.verse: So you will find favor,

5.verse: Trust in Yahweh with all your heart,

6.verse: In all your ways acknowledge him,

7.verse: Don’t be wise in your own eyes.

8.verse: It will be health to your body,

9.verse: Honor Yahweh with your substance,

10.verse: so your barns will be filled with plenty,

11.verse: My son, don’t despise Yahweh’s discipline,

12.verse: for whom Yahweh loves, he corrects,

13.verse: Happy is the man who finds wisdom,

14.verse: For her good profit is better than getting silver,

15.verse: She is more precious than rubies.

16.verse: Length of days is in her right hand.

17.verse: Her ways are ways of pleasantness.

18.verse: She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her.

19.verse: By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth.

20.verse: By his knowledge, the depths were broken up,

21.verse: My son, let them not depart from your eyes.

22.verse: so they will be life to your soul,

23.verse: Then you shall walk in your way securely.

24.verse: When you lie down, you will not be afraid.

25.verse: Don’t be afraid of sudden fear,

26.verse: for Yahweh will be your confidence,

27.verse: Don’t withhold good from those to whom it is due,

28.verse: Don’t say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again;

29.verse: Don’t devise evil against your neighbor,

30.verse: Don’t strive with a man without cause,

31.verse: Don’t envy the man of violence.

32.verse: For the perverse is an abomination to Yahweh,

33.verse: Yahweh’s curse is in the house of the wicked,

1.verse: Listen, sons, to a father’s instruction.

2.verse: for I give you sound learning.

3.verse: For I was a son to my father,

4.verse: He taught me, and said to me:

5.verse: Get wisdom.

6.verse: Don’t forsake her, and she will preserve you.

7.verse: Wisdom is supreme.

8.verse: Esteem her, and she will exalt you.

9.verse: She will give to your head a garland of grace.

10.verse: Listen, my son, and receive my sayings.

11.verse: I have taught you in the way of wisdom.

12.verse: When you go, your steps will not be hampered.

13.verse: Take firm hold of instruction.

14.verse: Don’t enter into the path of the wicked.

15.verse: Avoid it, and don’t pass by it.

16.verse: For they don’t sleep unless they do evil.

17.verse: For they eat the bread of wickedness

18.verse: But the path of the righteous is like the dawning light

19.verse: The way of the wicked is like darkness.

20.verse: My son, attend to my words.

21.verse: Let them not depart from your eyes.

22.verse: For they are life to those who find them,

23.verse: Keep your heart with all diligence,

24.verse: Put away from yourself a perverse mouth.

25.verse: Let your eyes look straight ahead.

26.verse: Make the path of your feet level.

27.verse: Don’t turn to the right hand nor to the left.

1.verse: My son, pay attention to my wisdom.

2.verse: that you may maintain discretion,

3.verse: For the lips of an adulteress drip honey.

4.verse: but in the end she is as bitter as wormwood,

5.verse: Her feet go down to death.

6.verse: She gives no thought to the way of life.

7.verse: Now therefore, my sons, listen to me.

8.verse: Remove your way far from her.

9.verse: lest you give your honor to others,

10.verse: lest strangers feast on your wealth,

11.verse: You will groan at your latter end,

12.verse: and say, “How I have hated instruction,

13.verse: I haven’t obeyed the voice of my teachers,

14.verse: I have come to the brink of utter ruin,

15.verse: Drink water out of your own cistern,

16.verse: Should your springs overflow in the streets,

17.verse: Let them be for yourself alone,

18.verse: Let your spring be blessed.

19.verse: A loving doe and a graceful deer—

20.verse: For why should you, my son, be captivated with an adulteress?

21.verse: For the ways of man are before Yahweh’s eyes.

22.verse: The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare him.

23.verse: He will die for lack of instruction.

1.verse: My son, if you have become collateral for your neighbor,

2.verse: you are trapped by the words of your mouth;

3.verse: Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself,

4.verse: Give no sleep to your eyes,

5.verse: Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,

6.verse: Go to the ant, you sluggard.

7.verse: which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,

8.verse: provides her bread in the summer,

9.verse: How long will you sleep, sluggard?

10.verse: A little sleep, a little slumber,

11.verse: so your poverty will come as a robber,

12.verse: A worthless person, a man of iniquity,

13.verse: who winks with his eyes, who signals with his feet,

14.verse: in whose heart is perverseness,

15.verse: Therefore his calamity will come suddenly.

16.verse: There are six things which Yahweh hates;

17.verse: arrogant eyes, a lying tongue,

18.verse: a heart that devises wicked schemes,

19.verse: a false witness who utters lies,

20.verse: My son, keep your father’s commandment,

21.verse: Bind them continually on your heart.

22.verse: When you walk, it will lead you.

23.verse: For the commandment is a lamp,

24.verse: to keep you from the immoral woman,

25.verse: Don’t lust after her beauty in your heart,

26.verse: For a prostitute reduces you to a piece of bread.

27.verse: Can a man scoop fire into his lap,

28.verse: Or can one walk on hot coals,

29.verse: So is he who goes in to his neighbor’s wife.

31.verse: but if he is found, he shall restore seven times.

32.verse: He who commits adultery with a woman is void of understanding.

33.verse: He will get wounds and dishonor.

34.verse: For jealousy arouses the fury of the husband.

1.verse: My son, keep my words.

2.verse: Keep my commandments and live!

3.verse: Bind them on your fingers.

4.verse: Tell wisdom, “You are my sister.”

5.verse: that they may keep you from the strange woman,

6.verse: For at the window of my house,

7.verse: I saw among the simple ones.

8.verse: passing through the street near her corner,

9.verse: in the twilight, in the evening of the day,

10.verse: Behold, there a woman met him with the attire of a prostitute,

11.verse: She is loud and defiant.

12.verse: Now she is in the streets, now in the squares,

13.verse: So she caught him, and kissed him.

14.verse: “Sacrifices of peace offerings are with me.

15.verse: Therefore I came out to meet you,

16.verse: I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry,

17.verse: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.verse: Come, let’s take our fill of loving until the morning.

19.verse: For my husband isn’t at home.

20.verse: He has taken a bag of money with him.

21.verse: With persuasive words, she led him astray.

22.verse: He followed her immediately,

23.verse: Until an arrow strikes through his liver,

24.verse: Now therefore, sons, listen to me.

25.verse: Don’t let your heart turn to her ways.

26.verse: for she has thrown down many wounded.

27.verse: Her house is the way to Sheol,

1.verse: Doesn’t wisdom cry out?

2.verse: On the top of high places by the way,

3.verse: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city,

4.verse: “I call to you men!

5.verse: You simple, understand prudence!

6.verse: Hear, for I will speak excellent things.

7.verse: For my mouth speaks truth.

8.verse: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness.

9.verse: They are all plain to him who understands,

10.verse: Receive my instruction rather than silver,

11.verse: For wisdom is better than rubies.

12.verse: “I, wisdom, have made prudence my dwelling.

13.verse: The fear of Yahweh is to hate evil.

14.verse: Counsel and sound knowledge are mine.

15.verse: By me kings reign,

16.verse: By me princes rule,

17.verse: I love those who love me.

18.verse: With me are riches, honor,

19.verse: My fruit is better than gold, yes, than fine gold,

20.verse: I walk in the way of righteousness,

21.verse: that I may give wealth to those who love me.

22.verse: “Yahweh possessed me in the beginning of his work,

23.verse: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning,

24.verse: When there were no depths, I was born,

25.verse: Before the mountains were settled in place,

26.verse: while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields,

27.verse: When he established the heavens, I was there.

28.verse: when he established the clouds above,

29.verse: when he gave to the sea its boundary,

30.verse: then I was the craftsman by his side.

32.verse: “Now therefore, my sons, listen to me,

34.verse: Blessed is the man who hears me,

35.verse: For whoever finds me, finds life,

36.verse: But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul.

1.verse: Wisdom has built her house.

2.verse: She has prepared her meat.

3.verse: She has sent out her maidens.

4.verse: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”

5.verse: “Come, eat some of my bread,

6.verse: Leave your simple ways, and live.

7.verse: One who corrects a mocker invites insult.

8.verse: Don’t reprove a scoffer, lest he hate you.

9.verse: Instruct a wise person, and he will be still wiser.

10.verse: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom.

11.verse: For by me your days will be multiplied.

12.verse: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself.

13.verse: The foolish woman is loud,

14.verse: She sits at the door of her house,

15.verse: to call to those who pass by,

16.verse: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here.”

17.verse: “Stolen water is sweet.

18.verse: But he doesn’t know that the departed spirits are there,

1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon.

2.verse: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing,

3.verse: Yahweh will not allow the soul of the righteous to go hungry,

4.verse: He becomes poor who works with a lazy hand,

5.verse: He who gathers in summer is a wise son,

6.verse: Blessings are on the head of the righteous,

7.verse: The memory of the righteous is blessed,

8.verse: The wise in heart accept commandments,

9.verse: He who walks blamelessly walks surely,

10.verse: One winking with the eye causes sorrow,

11.verse: The mouth of the righteous is a spring of life,

12.verse: Hatred stirs up strife,

13.verse: Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has discernment,

14.verse: Wise men lay up knowledge,

15.verse: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city.

16.verse: The labor of the righteous leads to life.

17.verse: He is in the way of life who heeds correction,

18.verse: He who hides hatred has lying lips.

19.verse: In the multitude of words there is no lack of disobedience,

20.verse: The tongue of the righteous is like choice silver.

21.verse: The lips of the righteous feed many,

22.verse: Yahweh’s blessing brings wealth,

23.verse: It is a fool’s pleasure to do wickedness,

24.verse: What the wicked fear will overtake them,

25.verse: When the whirlwind passes, the wicked is no more;

26.verse: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes,

27.verse: The fear of Yahweh prolongs days,

28.verse: The prospect of the righteous is joy,

29.verse: The way of Yahweh is a stronghold to the upright,

30.verse: The righteous will never be removed,

31.verse: The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom,

32.verse: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable,

1.verse: A false balance is an abomination to Yahweh,

2.verse: When pride comes, then comes shame,

3.verse: The integrity of the upright shall guide them,

4.verse: Riches don’t profit in the day of wrath,

5.verse: The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way,

6.verse: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them,

7.verse: When a wicked man dies, hope perishes,

8.verse: A righteous person is delivered out of trouble,

9.verse: With his mouth the godless man destroys his neighbor,

10.verse: When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices.

11.verse: By the blessing of the upright, the city is exalted,

12.verse: One who despises his neighbor is void of wisdom,

13.verse: One who brings gossip betrays a confidence,

14.verse: Where there is no wise guidance, the nation falls,

15.verse: He who is collateral for a stranger will suffer for it,

16.verse: A gracious woman obtains honor,

17.verse: The merciful man does good to his own soul,

18.verse: Wicked people earn deceitful wages,

19.verse: He who is truly righteous gets life.

20.verse: Those who are perverse in heart are an abomination to Yahweh,

21.verse: Most certainly, the evil man will not be unpunished,

22.verse: Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout,

23.verse: The desire of the righteous is only good.

24.verse: There is one who scatters, and increases yet more.

25.verse: The liberal soul shall be made fat.

26.verse: People curse someone who withholds grain,

27.verse: He who diligently seeks good seeks favor,

28.verse: He who trusts in his riches will fall,

29.verse: He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind.

30.verse: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life.

31.verse: Behold, the righteous shall be repaid in the earth,

1.verse: Whoever loves correction loves knowledge,

2.verse: A good man shall obtain favor from Yahweh,

3.verse: A man shall not be established by wickedness,

4.verse: A worthy woman is the crown of her husband,

5.verse: The thoughts of the righteous are just,

6.verse: The words of the wicked are about lying in wait for blood,

7.verse: The wicked are overthrown, and are no more,

8.verse: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom,

9.verse: Better is he who is little known, and has a servant,

10.verse: A righteous man respects the life of his animal,

11.verse: He who tills his land shall have plenty of bread,

12.verse: The wicked desires the plunder of evil men,

13.verse: An evil man is trapped by sinfulness of lips,

14.verse: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth.

15.verse: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,

16.verse: A fool shows his annoyance the same day,

17.verse: He who is truthful testifies honestly,

18.verse: There is one who speaks rashly like the piercing of a sword,

19.verse: Truth’s lips will be established forever,

20.verse: Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil,

21.verse: No mischief shall happen to the righteous,

22.verse: Lying lips are an abomination to Yahweh,

23.verse: A prudent man keeps his knowledge,

24.verse: The hands of the diligent ones shall rule,

25.verse: Anxiety in a man’s heart weighs it down,

26.verse: A righteous person is cautious in friendship,

27.verse: The slothful man doesn’t roast his game,

28.verse: In the way of righteousness is life;

1.verse: A wise son listens to his father’s instruction,

2.verse: By the fruit of his lips, a man enjoys good things,

3.verse: He who guards his mouth guards his soul.

4.verse: The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing,

5.verse: A righteous man hates lies,

6.verse: Righteousness guards the way of integrity,

7.verse: There are some who pretend to be rich, yet have nothing.

8.verse: The ransom of a man’s life is his riches,

9.verse: The light of the righteous shines brightly,

10.verse: Pride only breeds quarrels,

11.verse: Wealth gained dishonestly dwindles away,

12.verse: Hope deferred makes the heart sick,

13.verse: Whoever despises instruction will pay for it,

14.verse: The teaching of the wise is a spring of life,

15.verse: Good understanding wins favor,

16.verse: Every prudent man acts from knowledge,

17.verse: A wicked messenger falls into trouble,

18.verse: Poverty and shame come to him who refuses discipline,

19.verse: Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul,

20.verse: One who walks with wise men grows wise,

21.verse: Misfortune pursues sinners,

22.verse: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,

23.verse: An abundance of food is in poor people’s fields,

24.verse: One who spares the rod hates his son,

25.verse: The righteous one eats to the satisfying of his soul,

1.verse: Every wise woman builds her house,

2.verse: He who walks in his uprightness fears Yahweh,

3.verse: The fool’s talk brings a rod to his back,

4.verse: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean,

5.verse: A truthful witness will not lie,

6.verse: A scoffer seeks wisdom, and doesn’t find it,

7.verse: Stay away from a foolish man,

8.verse: The wisdom of the prudent is to think about his way,

9.verse: Fools mock at making atonement for sins,

10.verse: The heart knows its own bitterness and joy;

11.verse: The house of the wicked will be overthrown,

12.verse: There is a way which seems right to a man,

13.verse: Even in laughter the heart may be sorrowful,

14.verse: The unfaithful will be repaid for his own ways;

15.verse: A simple man believes everything,

16.verse: A wise man fears and shuns evil,

17.verse: He who is quick to become angry will commit folly,

18.verse: The simple inherit folly,

19.verse: The evil bow down before the good,

20.verse: The poor person is shunned even by his own neighbor,

21.verse: He who despises his neighbor sins,

22.verse: Don’t they go astray who plot evil?

23.verse: In all hard work there is profit,

24.verse: The crown of the wise is their riches,

25.verse: A truthful witness saves souls,

26.verse: In the fear of Yahweh is a secure fortress,

27.verse: The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life,

28.verse: In the multitude of people is the king’s glory,

29.verse: He who is slow to anger has great understanding,

30.verse: The life of the body is a heart at peace,

31.verse: He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for his Maker,

32.verse: The wicked is brought down in his calamity,

33.verse: Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding,

35.verse: The king’s favor is toward a servant who deals wisely,

1.verse: A gentle answer turns away wrath,

2.verse: The tongue of the wise commends knowledge,

3.verse: Yahweh’s eyes are everywhere,

4.verse: A gentle tongue is a tree of life,

5.verse: A fool despises his father’s correction,

6.verse: In the house of the righteous is much treasure,

7.verse: The lips of the wise spread knowledge;

8.verse: The sacrifice made by the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh,

9.verse: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh,

10.verse: There is stern discipline for one who forsakes the way:

11.verse: Sheol and Abaddon are before Yahweh—

12.verse: A scoffer doesn’t love to be reproved;

13.verse: A glad heart makes a cheerful face,

14.verse: The heart of one who has understanding seeks knowledge,

15.verse: All the days of the afflicted are wretched,

16.verse: Better is little, with the fear of Yahweh,

17.verse: Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is,

18.verse: A wrathful man stirs up contention,

19.verse: The way of the sluggard is like a thorn patch,

20.verse: A wise son makes a father glad,

21.verse: Folly is joy to one who is void of wisdom,

22.verse: Where there is no counsel, plans fail;

23.verse: Joy comes to a man with the reply of his mouth.

24.verse: The path of life leads upward for the wise,

25.verse: Yahweh will uproot the house of the proud,

26.verse: Yahweh detests the thoughts of the wicked,

27.verse: He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house,

28.verse: The heart of the righteous weighs answers,

29.verse: Yahweh is far from the wicked,

30.verse: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart.

31.verse: The ear that listens to reproof lives,

32.verse: He who refuses correction despises his own soul,

33.verse: The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom.

1.verse: The plans of the heart belong to man,

2.verse: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes;

3.verse: Commit your deeds to Yahweh,

4.verse: Yahweh has made everything for its own end—

5.verse: Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to Yahweh:

6.verse: By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for.

7.verse: When a man’s ways please Yahweh,

8.verse: Better is a little with righteousness,

9.verse: A man’s heart plans his course,

10.verse: Inspired judgments are on the lips of the king.

11.verse: Honest balances and scales are Yahweh’s;

12.verse: It is an abomination for kings to do wrong,

13.verse: Righteous lips are the delight of kings.

14.verse: The king’s wrath is a messenger of death,

15.verse: In the light of the king’s face is life.

16.verse: How much better it is to get wisdom than gold!

17.verse: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil.

18.verse: Pride goes before destruction,

19.verse: It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor,

20.verse: He who heeds the Word finds prosperity.

21.verse: The wise in heart shall be called prudent.

22.verse: Understanding is a fountain of life to one who has it,

23.verse: The heart of the wise instructs his mouth,

24.verse: Pleasant words are a honeycomb,

25.verse: There is a way which seems right to a man,

26.verse: The appetite of the laboring man labors for him;

27.verse: A worthless man devises mischief.

28.verse: A perverse man stirs up strife.

29.verse: A man of violence entices his neighbor,

30.verse: One who winks his eyes to plot perversities,

31.verse: Gray hair is a crown of glory.

32.verse: One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty;

33.verse: The lot is cast into the lap,

1.verse: Better is a dry morsel with quietness,

2.verse: A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who causes shame,

3.verse: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold,

4.verse: An evildoer heeds wicked lips.

5.verse: Whoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker.

6.verse: Children’s children are the crown of old men;

7.verse: Excellent speech isn’t fitting for a fool,

8.verse: A bribe is a precious stone in the eyes of him who gives it;

9.verse: He who covers an offense promotes love;

10.verse: A rebuke enters deeper into one who has understanding

11.verse: An evil man seeks only rebellion;

12.verse: Let a bear robbed of her cubs meet a man,

13.verse: Whoever rewards evil for good,

14.verse: The beginning of strife is like breaching a dam,

15.verse: He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the righteous,

16.verse: Why is there money in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom,

17.verse: A friend loves at all times;

18.verse: A man void of understanding strikes hands,

19.verse: He who loves disobedience loves strife.

20.verse: One who has a perverse heart doesn’t find prosperity,

21.verse: He who becomes the father of a fool grieves.

22.verse: A cheerful heart makes good medicine,

23.verse: A wicked man receives a bribe in secret,

24.verse: Wisdom is before the face of one who has understanding,

25.verse: A foolish son brings grief to his father,

26.verse: Also to punish the righteous is not good,

27.verse: He who spares his words has knowledge.

28.verse: Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is counted wise.

1.verse: A man who isolates himself pursues selfishness,

2.verse: A fool has no delight in understanding,

3.verse: When wickedness comes, contempt also comes,

4.verse: The words of a man’s mouth are like deep waters.

5.verse: To be partial to the faces of the wicked is not good,

6.verse: A fool’s lips come into strife,

7.verse: A fool’s mouth is his destruction,

8.verse: The words of a gossip are like dainty morsels:

9.verse: One who is slack in his work

10.verse: Yahweh’s name is a strong tower:

11.verse: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city,

12.verse: Before destruction the heart of man is proud,

13.verse: He who answers before he hears,

14.verse: A man’s spirit will sustain him in sickness,

15.verse: The heart of the discerning gets knowledge.
